TopicTitle: Devnote Tuesdays: The Award Winning Community Edition

Articles.Content:
<p><span><img src="https://31.media.tumblr.com/0ff9377afa68dc3ad3fe6844aaf1bd38/tumblr_inline_n30mxgXWvv1rr2wit.jpg"/></span></p>

<p><strong>Felipe (HarvesteR)</strong><span><strong>:</strong> Testing continues for the ARM patch, the test team has been at it non-stop even while we were at the GDC, and while I was expecting to be greeted by a wall of bugs, what I found instead were a few very well documented issues which we managed to fix very quickly, mainly due to the thoroughness of the documentation about them. Props to the test team for that! Today weÃ¢â‚¬â„¢re still ironing out some details, but all in all, things are coming together nicely. Let me also add my thanks to all of you for choosing us to win the GDC Audience Awards! IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢m at a loss for words to express how much that meant to usÃ¢â‚¬Â¦ Really, thank you!</span></p>

<p><span><strong>Alex (aLeXmOrA):</strong> </span><span>IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢m still working on the in-game stats page in the website that will let us know how far the players are going in the game (it will only be available for us to see it, I just have to make that clear.) Also, helping with other Squad projects. I just want to thank you for the GDC Audience Award! It means a lot to all of us, here. Three years of development have been worth it!</span></p>

<p><strong>Mike (Mu):</strong><span> *WeÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ve been pressing on with testing and refinement of the contract system in preparation for 0.24. </span></p>

<p><strong>Marco (Samsonart):</strong><span> IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢m still a little shocked about the GDC Audience award, thanks everyone! Other than that doing my fair share of bug fixing for the ARM patch.</span></p>

<p><strong>Daniel (danRosas)</strong><span><strong>:</strong> Doing those very small, almost imperceptible, final details of the animation. Almost thereÃ¢â‚¬Â¦</span><span> </span><span></span></p>

<p><strong>Miguel (Maxmaps): </strong><span>Worked on the KSPTV Marathon, ensured the whole media group would have access to the experimental builds, cheered at GDC glory (all yours, guys).</span><span></span></p>

<p><strong>Jesus (Chuchito): </strong><span>A bit hard week, solving some weird bugs on the KSP Server, pressing on the serverÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s stability flooding it with messages.</span><span></span></p>

<p><strong>Bob (Calisker): </strong><span>Thanks to everybody who attended the meetup in San Francisco and C7 and my talks at GDC. I was stoked to share with everybody what makes our community the best in gaming and how we try to keep it that way. WeÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ll keep learning and hopefully, getting better at communicating to our player base and gamers who havenÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t tried </span><span>KSP</span><span> yet too. This week, weÃ¢â‚¬â„¢re working on getting the Asteroid Redirect Mission ready and following up on a zillion things from GDC. Oh yeah, thanks again for your votes to win the Game Developer Choice Audience Award - wow was that awesome. </span></p>

<p><strong>Ted (Ted): </strong><span>IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ve been working with the Experimental Team on testing and providing feedback for the ARM Patch, whilst QAing the 0.24 content with the QA Team. ItÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s been a very busy past week to say the least!</span></p>

<p><span><strong>Anthony (Rowsdower):</strong> IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ve been keeping the ARM hype alive by posting all over the place. The media team, KSP-TV and the press (in no specific order) has done a great job spreading the word and ItÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s been fun helping to bring their work to you. Speaking of hard work, your fingers must be hurting from all those mouse clicks. IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ve always told people that the KSP community is the best, but now we have a physical award that proves it. You are the finest, most loyal, smartest, funniest and insanely interesting (among other positive adjectives) group of people that a CM could even hope to represent. We were all seriously shocked to have beat out both enormous AAA games and similarly popular indie titles for it. They may have had other things going for them, but in the end, it was your passion that won out overall. From the very bottom of all of our hearts here at Squad - thank you for dedication. The Game Developers Choice Audience Award is for all of you.<br/></span></p>

<p><strong>Eduardo (Lalo):</strong><span> Im really happy and in this moment i just want to thanks all the fans for your votes to win the Game Developer Choice Audience Award, it was an amazing surprise.</span></p>

Edited March 30, 2014 by SQUAD
Congratas on winning GDC!
Congratulations, guys.

Congratulations for winning the award!

ARM patch sounds awesome!
Congrats on GDC! ARM is so close I can practically taste it!

I imagine the "killer" asteroid hitting Kerbin to just plop down without incident during the marathon is one of the things to be ironed out Greatly looking forward to when it is finished as well as .24. You guys do an amazing job!

The tiny sad 'bloop' when an asteroid splashed down into the sea during the marathon was a bit,... odd I guess?

Given things like HotRockets, CoolRockets and now SmokeScreen all flexing the particle system, hopefully someone applies it to the explosions (for both parts and asteroids)

One I meant was an E that couldn't be turned off impact course and ended up doing a huge reentry to slow down to ~200m/s on its own, hit an island where in just went "bop" then rolled slightly Sure they aren't supposed to destroy the planet or anything, but that was a bit too nerf
Congratulations for winning the award!
Way to go, Squad!

Jesus (Chuchito): ...KSP Server...
Wait.... KSP Server? Does this possibly mean.... MULTIPLAYER?

Wait.... KSP Server? Does this possibly mean.... MULTIPLAYER?

This is pretty old news. Yes, he's working on the server system that will eventually be used for Multiplayer
Don't get too excited - this is just putting underlying code in while it is still easy, before other changes to the code base make it too difficult. The actual MP will take a lot, lot longer!

Woohoo! Awesome! And thank YOU for all you've done for us!

Edited March 26, 2014 by Avera9eJoe
Yes, right now the server work seems to be in ironing out chat and stress testing; not strictly KSP but later an integral element of the whole.

Squad, why did you have to build hype with the media team! I now check the forums every minute and probably gonna have a dream about it!

Oh wait, I already did.
Congrats on the Audience Award. You have created a gaming experience that inspires passion, and that is definitely reflected in the community and its support.

The tiny sad 'bloop' when an asteroid splashed down into the sea during the marathon was a bit,... odd I guess?

Given things like HotRockets, CoolRockets and now SmokeScreen all flexing the particle system, hopefully someone applies it to the explosions (for both parts and asteroids)

That 'bloop' (or 'plop' when it falls on land) is not completely unrealistic, given the atmosphere already slowed it down to 100 m/s. Even the Russian meteor did not cause significant damage by its impact. The reentry was the damaging event.

I'm not sure if I really want physical reentry damage implemented but it would be cool to have it for asteroids. They could fragment to lower class asteroids and these could also continue fragmenting, bringing the bigger meteor shower the bigger asteroid you brought.

Although then I'm not sure about what kind of redirecting would actually happen in the game.

Edited March 26, 2014 by Kasuha
Congratulation for a super deserved award... Keep going forward!

A well deserved award for a project of heart and passion... Congratulations

I am really looking forward to the ARM patch... Lots of projects on my mind that need realization... And thank you, for all the hard work!

That 'bloop' (or 'plop' when it falls on land) is not completely unrealistic, given the atmosphere already slowed it down to 100 m/s. Even the Russian meteor did not cause significant damage by its impact. The reentry was the damaging event.

I'm not sure if I really want physical reentry damage implemented but it would be cool to have it for asteroids. They could fragment to lower class asteroids and these could also continue fragmenting, bringing the bigger meteor shower the bigger asteroid you brought.

Although then I'm not sure about what kind of redirecting would actually happen in the game.

I just thought it was odd that a few tons of engines and solar panels (and one claw) made a made substantially bigger splash than a much larger object which also weighed several hundred tons

Not asking for Armageddon / Deep-impact style tidal waves or anything, but the effect didn't quite convey the gravitas of the impact

I've been increasingly amused by Jesus' status updates with every new Devnote Tuesday. All the rest of the team is like an uniform chorus "GDC! Bugfixing! Awards! Final Polish! Asteroids!"... and then Jesus goes "I'm flooding my server with messages". It's been that way for several weeks now, and it just looks so hilariously offbeat in the middle of the rest.

Gives me this mental image of him sitting in a dark windowless cabinet somewhere in the depths of the office, lit only by the light of monitors, hacking away at the keyboard and devoting no more than an offhanded one-liner to the pesky outside world interrupting him once per week. Does the rest of the Squad team see him come and leave? Is his physical existence a mere myth by now? Who knows?

Keep up the good work, Jesus
Congrats on the GDC Award SQUAD! Excellent work thus far with the game. I've been very eagerly awaiting my STEAM client starting the download for the ARM patch. Bigger Rockets = Bigger EXPLOSIONS!!1!
Congratulations Developer and it just sounds awesome what you are doing there!

Congrats on the GDC award 3 YEARS GUYS! way to go! I joined when 19.8 came out and followed through all those patches,you guys are so awesome! Cant wait for the ARM patch,I cant wait to get hands on that new NASA flag :3 Man,greatest game ever,you guys interact with the community,i love it
